sense.name: carnival or show
sense.commentary: FAIR[+event] A traveling show, primarily for entertainment.
sense.examples: I heard there's going to be a fair coming to town! John and Mary attended the fair and held hands on the Ferris wheel. I walked out of the fair and had to pay to get back in.

sense.name: gathering of producers
sense.commentary: FAIR[+event] A gathering of business-people or producers, meant to promote business. Usually an adjective attached.
sense.examples: The book fair is being held in the library. I met my business partner at the 1979 International Trade Fair. The World's Fair brought travelers from all over. John's cow won a blue ribbon at the County Fair.
